content: I'm seeing a couple of issues with https://healthterminologies.gov.au/fhir/ValueSet/common-languages-australia-2 version 2.0.0
Duplicate code includes for codes kmr, djd, dyy and wbp.
Mostly harmless, with the exception of dyy - those includes define different displays
@Jaymee Murdoch , do we have an issue logged on this?

Thanks for raising @Jim Steel .
I have logged and we will correct in the April release. Can I ask if you identified the issues through some sort of FHIR validation mechanism?

No, unfortunately not. I have been maintaining a BCP47 CodeSystem (extract only), and I converted all the VS includes into a CSV for addition into my CodeSystem, and Ontoserver complained when I tried to create the CodeSystem with the extra codes

FYI- I have raised a PR on the au-fhir-base to update the version to v2 (au-patient, au-practitioner and Healthcare Service Communication extension):
https://github.com/hl7au/au-fhir-base/pull/251

Hmm, http://hl7.org/fhir/STU3/codesystem.html#invs has

csd-1: Within a code system definition, all the codes SHALL be unique (expression : (concept.code | descendants().concept.code).isDistinct())

so I would have expected $validate to pick that up
This was duplication in the ValueSet include, rather than in the CodeSystem
